skillTree.localised_description: The Blood God’s own Flesh Hound is a colossal Daemon of great power, ridden on the battlefield in the fashion of a monstrous beast.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit is branded with the Mark of Khorne, and is affected by Khorne Authority.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Each victory reinvigorates Khorne's champions to seek more bloodshed.

effects.description: Replenishes 20% campaign movement range after winning a battle
Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after razing a settlement
Replenishes 30% campaign movement range after winning a battle
Replenishes 20% campaign movement range after razing a settlement

skillTree.localised_description: Fluttering and flouncing into battle is the way of the weak and self-indulgent. War should be waged Kharneth's way – with pure, unbridled savagery.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Slaaneshi factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Slaaneshi factions

skillTree.localised_description: At times, this servant of Khorne storms across the battlefield with arrows lodged in his chest. However, they seem to do little but further stoke the raging fire of his wrath.
Few magics can worm their way through this one's skull; their Khornate collar offers adequate protection, as does the impenetrable, relentless fury infecting his mind.

effects.description:
Enemy fire resistance: -5%
	(enemy armies in region)

Enemy fire resistance: -10%
	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Should Arbaal's resolve shatter, an eternity as a Chaos Spawn awaits him. A similar fate also awaits anyone in his vicinity, for a short and painful while.

effects.description:
Enables replenishment in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Chaos Spawn
Causes severe damage to combatants
Summoned units have specific debuffs conditions

skillTree.localised_description: Nothing hones the blade of a Khornite better than the wailing of initial onslaught and the blood spattering its aftermath.
The millennia seem to have not taught Arbaal patience in battle. And in truth, he has as much need for it as does a hurricane against a hovel.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each enemy entity in range
Effect intensity increases with each enemy entity in range

skillTree.localised_description: What devotions a Daemon Prince garners by dint of his miasmic aura, Arbaal achieves by sheer might of will.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Eye of Khorne"

skillTree.localised_description: Arbaal is the ever-living proof that a human being is no lesser a conduit for the Ruinous power of Khorne.

effects.description:
Attribute: Devastating Flanker for Chaos Knights and Skullcrushers units
	(all units in army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

Attribute: Expert Charge Defence for non-Daemonic Infantry units
	(all units in army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Would you die ignobly as He watches? Would you have your flesh spun into a Spawn? If so, I shall kill you myself. If not, follow me."

effects.description:
Attribute: Unbreakable for non-Daemonic units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

effects.description:
Attribute: Unbreakable for non-Daemonic units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
No foe remains a threat once torn limb from bloody limb!
"KILL! KILL THEM ALL!"
"Raze it all to the ground! Leave nothing standing!"
With every other thought squeezed from their mind, there is naught left of this one but the screaming song of slaughter.

attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.

skillTree.localised_description: Death, malice, butchery and murder – the enemies of Khorne shall have it all.
"None shall run far! None shall be able to hide! All will come to sufferance!"
"Modulistic terror – a vast, sadistic feast. The only way to exit is going piece by piece."
All will know agony, pulverised by the inescapable grip of the Blood God's hatred.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Feet of Khorne march across the corpses of their enemies, as the Teeth of Death crush the life from those yet to die.

skillTree.localised_description: Still awash with the blood of the conquered, the most devoted servants of war deliver skulls afore the Blood God's Skull Throne.

skillTree.localised_description: A single moment is all it takes to become lost in a vicious maelstrom of wing, tooth and claw.

skillTree.localised_description: The machinery of war creates a symphony of destruction out of booming cannon fire and the creaking of blood-soaked, hellish mechanisms.

skillTree.localised_description: Where this Lord's rabid warriors appear, slaughter and Ruination are always sure to follow.

skillTree.localised_description: Leaving a trail of carnage and devastation in their wake, Khorne's Chosen are the most fervent acolytes of annihilation.

skillTree.localised_description: Many armies are lost almost instantly under an avalanche of uninhibited, murderous rage. Such things are wondrous to behold.

skillTree.localised_description: Into the heart of the enemy race the feral hounds of havoc and destruction.

skillTree.localised_description: The diabolic engines of war rumble with the endless wrath of the Blood God himself.

skillTree.localised_description: There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption – as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

effects.description:
All other types of corruption: -1
	(local province)

All other types of corruption: -2
	(local province)

All other types of corruption: -3
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Every skull taken in the Blood God's honour proves this one's loyalty to the Skull Throne.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Visions cloud the mind, prophesising the arrival of the enemy and uncovering every shadow in which they lurk.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: This Khornate Lord's well of eternal rage never runs dry, nor does the ceaseless influx of warriors eager to serve under his command.

	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: There is no stopping this one's slaughter, for they are driven by the unquenchable lust for battle.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

factionEffects.localised_description: Were Khorne not watching, would Arbaal be capable of his hellish feats? It does not matter. Khorne is *always* watching.

effects.description: Has access to Challenges of Khorne, allowing Arbaal to seek out difficult battles to increase Khorne's favour and gain various rewards
Construction cost: -50% for Mortal Military and Defence buildings
Construction time: -50% for Mortal Military and Defence buildings
Passive ability: "Rage" for non-Daemonic units and characters

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

items.colour_text: Where Arbaal ends and the Destroyer begins is a false question. They both begin with Khorne's immortal wrath, and so neither will ever end.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit (150)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: From the moment a Northman grips steel, he imagines himself a new Arbaal. He needn't imagine, for here Arbaal stands, unvanquished and as inexorable as a glacier.
